meanings.definition: Promoting or relating to unity among different Christian churches or denominations.
meanings.sent1: The ecumenicalism event brought together various Christian groups for a common cause.
meanings.sent2: The ecumenicalism movement aims to foster cooperation and understanding among different denominations.
meanings.sent3: At the ecumenicalism picnic, all the churches joined forces to organize fun games for everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her inclusive and ecumenicalism approach to leadership brought harmony to the diverse congregation.
meanings.sent5: The ecumenicalism spirit filled the church as members from different denominations sang together in unity.

meanings.definition: The principle or aim of promoting unity among different Christian churches or denominations.
meanings.sent1: Ecumenicalism is essential for building strong relationships between Christian denominations.
meanings.sent2: The ecumenicalism of the council was evident in their efforts to bridge the gap between churches.
meanings.sent3: The ecumenicalism bake sale fundraiser was a great success in bringing churches together for a common cause.
meanings.sent4: In the world of ecumenicalism, collaboration and mutual respect are key values for church leaders.
meanings.sent5: The ecumenicalism conference served as a platform for dialogue and understanding among different Christian groups.
